author: Special Correspondent
text:
The district unit of the Bhratiya Janata Party has staged a demonstration, protesting against the incidents at Jawaharlal Nehru University in Delhi and the university students’ protest against the hanging of Mohammed Afzal Guru who played a vital role in the 2001 terrorist attack on the Parliament.

Addressing the protest demonstration here on Saturday, BJP election wing secretary K. Malaisamy condemned the JNU students for their act.

Stating that he was witness to the terror attack, the former AIADMK Rajya Sabha member hit out at the JNU students’ leader Kanhaiya Kumar for spearheading a campaign in support of the terrorist.

Justifying the hanging of Afzal Guru, he said those who protested against his execution should be treated as anti-national forces.

Senior BJP Leader D. Kuppuramu justified slapping of sedition charge against Kanhaiya Kumar and condemned the Congress and the left parties for supporting the JNU students.

“How can one tolerate if the JNU students raised slogans in support of Pakistan and against India,” he asked.

Speaking on the occasion, newly appointed BJP district secretary K. Muraleedharan hailed the Modi government for taking swift action against JNU student leader.
title: Demonstration against JNU incidents in Ramanathapuram
